greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Take the list of positive rationals {R(n): n>=1} in the order defined by Calkin and Wilf (Recounting the Rationals, 1999); a(n) = numerator of R(prime(n)).
comment: The list of rationals {R(n)} is essentially given by A002487(n)/A002487(n+1).
It appears that a(n) is always odd. This has been checked for all primes up to 999983.
link: N. Calkin and H. S. Wilf, Recounting the rationals, Amer. Math. Monthly, 107 (No. 4, 2000), pp. 360-363.
results.author: _James Kirk Winkler_, Aug 10 2015
